questions.text: Pakistan is a member of which regional organization?
questions.explanation: Pakistan is a member of SAARC (South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation).

questions.text: The CPEC (China-Pakistan Economic Corridor) was launched in:
questions.explanation: CPEC was officially launched in April 2015 with Chinese President Xi Jinping's visit to Pakistan.

questions.text: The ECO (Economic Cooperation Organization) was founded in:
questions.explanation: ECO was founded in 1985 by Pakistan, Iran, and Turkey to promote economic cooperation.

questions.text: Pakistan's first ambassador to the United Nations was:
questions.explanation: Sir Muhammad Zafarullah Khan was Pakistan's first ambassador to the UN and later served as ICJ President.

questions.text: The Durand Line is the border between Pakistan and:
questions.explanation: The Durand Line is the 2,670 km border between Pakistan and Afghanistan, established in 1893.

questions.text: BRICS is an economic grouping of which countries?

options.A: Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa

questions.explanation: BRICS stands for Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa - major emerging economies.

questions.text: Pakistan became a nuclear power in:
questions.explanation: Pakistan conducted its first nuclear tests on May 28, 1998, becoming a nuclear-armed state.

questions.text: The Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) was founded in:
questions.explanation: SCO was founded in 2001. Pakistan became a full member in 2017.
The Line of Control is the de facto border dividing Kashmir between Pakistan and India.

questions.text: Pakistan withdrew from CENTO (Central Treaty Organization) in:
questions.explanation: Pakistan withdrew from CENTO in 1979 following the Iranian Revolution and the organization dissolved.
